item.title: Metal Prices Fall on Concerns Ahead of Fed Meeting
item.description: Gold and base metals were lower in Europe as concerns weighed about the timing of interest rate cuts ahead of Wednesday’s Fed meeting.

item.title: Oil Builds on Last Week's Gains; Investors Await Fed Guidance
item.description: Oil prices continued to rise after hitting a four-month high last week, with investors turning their focus on a string of key central banks meetings this week.

item.title: China's Economy Has a New Problem: Its Job Market
item.description: Joblessness rose for the third straight month, pointing to pockets of weakness in China’s economy.

item.title: Yen Could Need Signals From BOJ on Future Rate Rises to Gain Significantly
item.description: MUFG said the BOJ’s meeting might not be a decisive turning point in boosting the yen even if the central bank ends negative interest rate policy and yield curve control.

item.title: Bang & Olufsen Cuts Full-Year Guidance
item.description: Bang & Olufsen warned that revenue and earnings for the fiscal year to May 31 would fall short of previous guidance due to a sluggish recovery in key European markets and the lack of a significant recovery in the Chinese economy.

item.title: Bearish Tone Could Prevail in Bond Markets This Week
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields were marginally lower but a bearish tone is expected this week in anticipation of central bank decisions, guidance and a busy supply schedule, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: Pakistan Carries Out Airstrikes Inside Afghanistan
item.description: The bombardment followed attacks in Pakistan that the authorities blamed on militants based across the border.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 2.7%, Led by Electronics, Real-Estate Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in electronics and real-estate stocks, as the yen gave up some of its recent gains ahead of the Bank of Japan’s policy outcome due Tuesday.

item.title: Singapore Exports Drop, But Data Still Show Signs of Recovery
item.description: Singapore’s non-oil domestic exports fell unexpectedly in February, signaling shaky trade momentum at the start of 2024.

item.title: XPeng's Shares Rise on Cheaper Brand Launch
item.description: XPeng’s shares rose in Hong Kong after the Chinese electric-vehicle maker disclosed plans to launch a cheaper mass-market brand amid intensified competition in China’s EV market.

item.title: Investors Get a Reminder That India Makes Sudden Moves Too
item.description: India’s Paytm, a pioneer in the country’s shift to mobile payments whose investors have included Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway and China’s Alibaba Group, has been shaken following an order from India’s central bank that largely crippled its banking affiliate.

item.title: Investors Get a Reminder That India Makes Sudden Moves Too
item.description: Foreign investors have increasingly shifted their investments to India from China in recent years, but a recent clampdown on one of its biggest financial technology companies has rattled some nerves.

item.title: Cuba Curtails Mobile Internet Service as Protesters Take to Streets
item.description: Hundreds of demonstrators protested in two cities Sunday against hourslong blackouts and lack of food.

item.title: BofA Securities, UBS in Lead to Secure Mandate for KKR's Philippines Hospital Stake Sale
item.description: KKR is expected to start a formal sale process soon for Metro Pacific Healthcare, the largest private hospital group in the Philippines.

item.title: China Turns on the Charm for Foreigners but Its Allure Has Faded
item.description: Beijing is increasing flights and easing visa rules, but business executives and diplomats say trust could be hard to rebuild.

item.title: Gaza Amputees Fight for Survival in Hospitals Hollowed Out by War
item.description: Doctors in Gaza are struggling to treat thousands of Palestinians who have lost limbs during the war.

item.title: If TikTok Is Banned, Free-Speech Litigation Could Follow
item.description: A legal battle would force the courts to weigh the government’s national security objectives against First Amendment rights of TikTok and its users.

item.title: Died: Ira Millstein, 97, advocate for responsible corporate governance.
item.description: Died: Ira Millstein, 97, advocate for responsible corporate governance.

item.title: Netanyahu rejected Schumer's call for new elections in Israel, dismissing the Senate majority leader's appeal as inappropriate and harmful to the war against Hamas.
item.description: Netanyahu rejected Schumer’s call for new elections in Israel, dismissing the Senate majority leader’s appeal as inappropriate and harmful to the war against Hamas.

item.title: Authorities are investigating Meta Platforms for its possible role in the illicit sale of drugs, according to documents and people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Authorities are investigating Meta Platforms for its possible role in the illicit sale of drugs, according to documents and people familiar with the matter.
